summary:
May 2025 Monthly Traffic Update (Auckland International Airport) - Key Data Points:

  • International Passengers (May 2025):
  • Total: 765k (+4% YoY), excluding transits: +6% YoY.
  • Load factors: 80% (+3.3pp YoY); short-haul 82% (+2.1pp), long-haul 77% (+4.8pp).

  • Top nationalities: NZ (52%, +6% YoY), Australia (10%, +5%), China (+7%), USA (+13%), India (-2% but +31% vs. 2019).

  • Domestic Passengers (May 2025):

  • Total: 667k (+1% YoY); load factors 81% (-0.9pp).

  • Trunk routes: Passengers +3%, capacity +4%, load factors 82%.

  • Queenstown Airport:

  • International passengers: 49k (+15% YoY).

  • Domestic passengers: 114k (-1% YoY).

  • FYTD Trends (Rolling 12 Months):

  • Total passengers: 18.7m (+1% YoY).
  • International: 10.3m (+3%); Domestic: 8.4m (-1%).

No material trading or capital markets impact identified (operational update only).

Monthly Operating Report Summary (May 2025) – Meridian Energy (ASX: MEZ)

Key Highlights:

  • Hydro Storage:
  • National hydro storage increased from 88% to 94% of historical average (9 June 2025).
  • South Island storage at 88%, North Island at 138% of average.

  • Waitaki catchment storage: 84% of average (vs. 118% for Waiau).

  • Inflows & Demand:

  • Total inflows at 106% of historical average (Waiau inflows 123%).
  • National electricity demand 6.1% lower YoY (May 2024 was unusually cold).

  • NZ Aluminium Smelter average load: 523MW (vs. 426MW in May 2024).

  • Retail Metrics:

  • Retail sales volumes +0.7% YoY, driven by:
    • Large business +10.5%, corporate +3.8% (offset by residential -4.4%, agriculture -8.1%).

  • Customer connections +0.4% MoM, +8.1% YoY.

  • Generation & Pricing:

  • Generation -14.2% YoY (lower hydro, higher wind).
  • Avg. generation price -32.9% YoY, avg. retail supply cost -28.7% YoY.

Material Data:

  • FY25 YTD (11 months):
  • Retail sales volumes -1.7% YoY; large business +7.8%, agriculture -13.2%.
  • Total generation -7.0% YoY; avg. generation price +15.7% YoY.

No material capital markets activity (routine operational update).
Source: Meridian Energy Monthly Operating Report (16 June 2025).

• Announcement Type: Results Release Date
  • Key Point: Full-year results for FY2025 will be released before market open on 18 August 2025.

No other material information identified.

Material Information Summary

  • Substantial Holding Change Disclosure:
  • Shareholder: Trouchet Shareholders (Barmil Enterprises, Eastglo Pty Ltd, KRLG Pty Ltd, Luke/Karl Trouchet).
  • Current Holding: 26,079,549 THL shares (11.795% of total).

  • Previous Holding: 26,066,901 shares (11.989% of total; dilution due to share issuance).

  • Co-operation Agreement:

  • Parties: Trouchet Shareholders + 5382917 Limited (SPV, linked to BGH Capital).
  • Purpose: Explore potential acquisition of THL via takeover offer/scheme of arrangement.
  • Key Terms:
    • Trouchet Shareholders restricted from selling shares without SPV consent until earlier of:
    • 14 December 2025;
    • Execution of scheme implementation agreement; or
    • Independent directors’ recommendation of offer.

  • Exclusivity: Trouchet Shareholders barred from engaging in competing proposals during the term.

  • Market Implications:

  • Potential control transaction in progress (subject to further announcements).
  • Lock-up of 11.8% of shares reduces liquidity; signals strategic interest.

No other material information identified.

Material Information Summary:

  • Substantial Holding Disclosure: BGH Capital and its associated entities (via SPV 5382917 Limited) have acquired a 17.795% stake in Tourism Holdings Limited (THL) (NZX: THL), totaling 39,345,432 shares.
  • Breakdown of Holdings:
  • 26,079,549 shares (11.795%) held via agreements with Trouchet Shareholders (lock-up until earlier of 14 Dec 2025 or transaction execution).
  • 13,265,883 shares (6.000%) acquired via on-market purchases from ANZ (8,843,922 shares at NZ$2.30/share) and ACC (4,421,961 shares at NZ$2.25/share), settling 18 June 2025.
  • Top-Up Mechanisms:
  • If SPV/BGH acquires full control (via scheme/takeover) within 12 months at a higher price, sellers receive the difference vs. agreed sale prices.
  • Matching payments triggered if SPV buys additional shares at prices >5c above acquisition prices within 20 business days.
  • Strategic Intent: BGH/Trouchet collaboration to explore takeover or scheme of arrangement for THL, with exclusivity until 14 Dec 2025.

Key Impact: Potential catalyst for THL’s valuation due to strategic stake accumulation and looming control transaction. Pricing mechanisms suggest upside if higher bid emerges.

• Unsolicited Non-Binding Offer: Received from BGH Capital/Trouchet consortium for NZ$2.30 per share (all-cash).
  • Conditions: Due diligence, debt finalisation, board recommendation, and independent advisor validation.
  • Alternative Structure: Consortium open to partial control (not 100% buyout).
  • BGH Share Acquisitions: Now holds 19.99% (44.2M shares) via purchases from ACC, ANZ, and WAM at NZ$2.25–$2.30/share with contingent escalation payments.
  • Board Response: Subcommittee formed; Luke Trouchet recused (leave of absence). Advisors: Jarden (financial), MinterEllisonRuddWatts (legal).
  • No Guarantee: Transaction remains uncertain; shareholders need not act yet.

Note: Material points focus on the offer terms, stake acquisition, and process management.

• Substantial Holder Disclosure:
  • Entities Involved: 5382917 Limited (SPV) and BGH Capital Group (BGH Fund & Manager).
  • Security: Ordinary shares in Tourism Holdings Limited (NZX: THL).
  • Movement:
    • SPV/BGH increased holding from 17.795% (39,345,432 shares) to 19.990% (44,197,503 shares).
  • Triggering Transaction:
    • On-market purchase of 4,852,071 shares from Wilson Asset Management (WAM) at NZ$2.25/share (total NZ$10.92M) on 16 June 2025.
    • Includes a contingent "top-up" payment if SPV/BGH launches a Scheme/ Takeover Offer (>NZ$2.25/share) within 12 months.

Key Implications:
- Potential M&A signal: 19.99% stake near NZ takeover code's 20% control threshold.
- Contingent payout structure suggests strategic intent (possible future bid).

Omitted: Legal boilerplate, director names, non-material transaction mechanics.

Note: NZX disclosure (not ASX), but materially relevant for THL trading.
